concise_definition: n. 怒视, 强光; v. 怒视, 闪耀

definitions.explanation_en: A strong, harsh, or dazzling light that is unpleasant or difficult to look at, often causing discomfort or reduced visibility.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一种强烈、刺眼或炫目的光线，令人不适或难以直视，常导致视觉不适或能见度降低。
definitions.example_en: The glare from the snow made it hard to see the road ahead.
definitions.example_cn: 雪地的强光使我们难以看清前方的道路。

definitions.explanation_en: An angry or hostile look directed at someone, often conveying disapproval, irritation, or contempt.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对某人投以愤怒或敌意的目光，通常表达不满、烦躁或轻蔑。
definitions.example_en: She gave him a glare that silenced the entire room.
definitions.example_cn: 她投去一记怒视，让整个房间瞬间安静下来。

definitions.explanation_en: To look at someone in an angry, hostile, or threatening way, often without speaking.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以愤怒、敌意或威胁的方式凝视某人，通常不说话。
definitions.example_en: He glared at the driver who cut him off in traffic.
definitions.example_cn: 他怒视着那个在他车前强行变道的司机。

definitions.explanation_en: To shine with a strong, harsh, or dazzling light, often reflecting off a surface.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以强烈、刺眼或炫目的光线照射，常指光线从表面反射。
definitions.example_en: The sun glared off the surface of the lake.
definitions.example_cn: 阳光在湖面上耀眼地反射。

comparison.analysis: “Stare” (凝视) 指长时间盯着看，可能出于好奇、惊讶或发呆，情感色彩中性或无明显敌意。而 “glare” 必然带有负面情绪，如愤怒或敌意，是一种带有攻击性的目光。
“Glimmer” (微光) 指微弱、闪烁、不稳定或隐约的光，常带有希望或神秘的意味。与 “glare” 完全相反：glare 是强烈刺眼的光，glimmer 是柔和暗淡的光。
“Flash” (闪光) 指短暂、突然的强光或光亮，持续时间极短，如闪电或相机闪光灯。而 “glare” 通常持续较长时间，是持续性的刺眼光线或目光，强调其持久性和压迫感。
